Author: Strob#3417
Content:
Yesterday I had only 6 nots for the last 6 hours, only cleaining I was doing was the cleanwallettransactions once a day but it didn't clean anything except for some tx in TXS. So I did the staked notary wallet reset and now I have 1 not every 15 minutes which is a huge improvement. So maybe not needed to use decker's script for now. Only difference is that decker script also recreate the wallet.dat file.

I'm also installing ZCL now.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content:
Hi, does anyone know what this error is about?```EXCEPTION: 15dbwrapper_error
Database I/O error
Komodo in AppInit()```

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Coming up when I start komodo.

Author: SHossain#0007
Content:
maybe restart computer and try again
if that doesn't fix, start wallet with `-reindex`

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Ok, I'll try that.  THanks.

Author: Strob#3417
Content: You can also try -reindex-chainstate first it's faster and may do the job

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Cool, Thanks üëç

Author: Strob#3417
Content: That one is for when you only suspect corruption of the chainstate

Author: Strob#3417
Content: While reindex is for when the blocks on disk are actually corrupted

Author: Strob#3417
Content: Does anyone flush memory and buffer cache as a maintenance routine?
